page.title: 20 LORISTON COUNTRY PARK? 2
page.content: to this eyesore ther is the other aesthetic problem of wind blown debris since the tip is on an exposed hill. The area also suffers from white acid run-off water leaching from the tip. The Countryside Commission for Scotland don't presently list it as an "officially recognised" County Park since it does not match up to their criteria. The Leisure and Recreation Department who pride themselves on their amenity provision would seem to be undeterred. They have produced a booklet entitled "Loriston Country Park" encouraging visitors to its sea, hills and cliffs but fails to mention the presence of the tip! Ironically if the tip is to removed in future years naturalists feel that the inevitable neat,grassed reclaimed site will be a far less valuable habitat for wildlife.
